alert.note: Alert for El Paso; Teller (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 12 at 9:43AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...SPECIAL HYDROLOGIC OUTLOOK... Widespread, heavy rainfall has impacted area rivers and creeks throughout Teller and El Paso Counties. Additional expected rainfall over the next 24 hours will continue to cause elevated river levels and possible flooding. Although flooding may not occur along some area rivers and creeks, swift moving water poses a hazard to those near waterways with inundation of low-lying areas still possible below flood stage levels. Particular areas of concern include the Monument and Fountain Creek corridors where homeless communities are at notable risk. Remain aware of changing conditions and rapidly rising river levels. Never drive through flowing water. Stay tuned to updates from the National Weather Service for the latest river forecasts and changing hydrologic conditions.
